Description: Four student aid lenders paid the United States a total of $57.75 million to resolve allegations that they improperly inflated their entitlement to certain interest rate subsidies from the U.S. Department of Education in violation of the False Claims Act.

Seven student loan companies agreed to reform their business practices and contribute a total of $1.4 million to a fund to assist students and their families. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was split evenly among them.

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
